page.title: 18Conservation and Wildlife
page.content: In this area wildlife is most abudant. Mammals include foxes, badgers, rabbits, hares and grey squirrels. Roadside verges are only cut in late summer so all can enjoy the wild flowers. Reptiles especially frog ad toads are common and both slow worms and common lizards have been observed. It is birds however that are the most noticable form of wildlife for the visitor. Buzzards, wren, goldcrest and goldfinch are common. Jays visit and owls can be heard if not seen. A nuthatch, a great spotted woodpecker and long tailed tits have been noted. The main reason forthis abundance is perhaps that farmers almost unwittingly practise conservation by leaving woods and hedges intact. There is also minimal use of chemical sprays. The almost total lack of industry also makes for clean air.
